Class BattleTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • BattleTest

  • public class BattleTest
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains all the unit tests related to the Battle class. Here any functionality related to the game are tested.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Battle endGame 
      private Battle infinityWar 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BattleTest() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setUp()
      This is where the objects of the battle class that needs to be tested is instantiated.
      void testAddGearToList1()
      This is a JUnit test to see if the user can add gears to the gear list 1 that can be utilized by the character 1.
      void testAddGearToList2()
      This is a JUnit test to see if the user can add gears to the gear list 2 that can be utilized by the character 2.
      void testGetGearList1Size()
      This is a JUnit test to see if the getGearList1Size method outputs the expected number of gears in the gear list 1.
      void testGetGearList2Size()
      This is a JUnit test to see if the getGearList2Size method outputs the expected number of gears in the gear list 2.
      void testGetWinner()
      This is a JUnit test to check if the winner of the game is as expected.
      void testInvalidAddGearToList1()
      This is a JUnit test to see if the user cannot add more than 10 gears to the gear list 1 and throws an IllegalStateException.
      void testInvalidAddGearToList2()
      This is a JUnit test to see if the user cannot add more than 10 gears to the gear list 2 and throws an IllegalStateException.
      void testPlayGame()
      This is a JUnit test to check if the game is played properly and the winner is as expected.
      void testPrepareRound()
      This is a JUnit test to check if the characters are equipped with correct number of gears from the list of gears they were provided with.
      void testToString()
      This JUnit test is used to test the toString method of the battle class.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • infinityWar

        public BattleTest()

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
        This is where the objects of the battle class that needs to be tested is instantiated. A battle object can have no arguments (uses default constructor) or takes 4 arguments: 1) Character 1, 2) Character 2, 3) Gear List 1, 4) Gear List 2.

      • testAddGearToList1

        public void testAddGearToList1()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This is a JUnit test to see if the user can add gears to the gear list 1 that can be utilized by the character 1.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testAddGearToList2

        public void testAddGearToList2()
        This is a JUnit test to see if the user can add gears to the gear list 2 that can be utilized by the character 2.

      • testInvalidAddGearToList1

        public void testInvalidAddGearToList1()
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        This is a JUnit test to see if the user cannot add more than 10 gears to the gear list 1 and throws an IllegalStateException.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testInvalidAddGearToList2

        public void testInvalidAddGearToList2()
        This is a JUnit test to see if the user cannot add more than 10 gears to the gear list 2 and throws an IllegalStateException.

      • testGetGearList1Size

        public void testGetGearList1Size()
        This is a JUnit test to see if the getGearList1Size method outputs the expected number of gears in the gear list 1.

      • testGetGearList2Size

        public void testGetGearList2Size()
        This is a JUnit test to see if the getGearList2Size method outputs the expected number of gears in the gear list 2.

      • testPrepareRound

        public void testPrepareRound()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        This is a JUnit test to check if the characters are equipped with correct number of gears from the list of gears they were provided with.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testPlayGame

        public void testPlayGame()
        This is a JUnit test to check if the game is played properly and the winner is as expected.
